thread.title: Golden Gals Connecticut Highlighted in New Feature Article for Ethical Breeding and Commitment to Early Socialization | User | dailytimesleader.com
thread.title_full: Golden Gals Connecticut Highlighted in New Feature Article for Ethical Breeding and Commitment to Early Socialization | User | dailytimesleader.com

author: Daily Times Leader
title: Golden Gals Connecticut Highlighted in New Feature Article for Ethical Breeding and Commitment to Early Socialization | User | dailytimesleader.com
text:
The Golden Gals Connecticut Golden Gals Connecticut, a respected family-run golden retriever breeding program, has been featured in a new spotlight article that explores their thoughtful, ethical approach to raising well-tempered dogs. Bethany, CT - Golden Gals Connecticut, a respected family-run golden retriever breeding program, has been featured in a new spotlight article that explores their thoughtful, ethical approach to raising well-tempered dogs. The article highlights co-founders Ashley and Steve Kubik’s dedication to early socialization, home-based care, and lifelong support for families adopting their puppies.
The piece, written in the style of a tech blogger’s semi-biographical deep dive, gives readers an inside look at how Golden Gals Connecticut sets itself apart from conventional breeders.
“We’re not here to compete or outshine anyone,” said Ashley Kubik in the article. “We’re just trying to raise the kind of dogs we’d want in our own home. And that starts with love, patience, and doing things the right way.”
A Spotlight on Responsible Breeding
The article sheds light on several key elements of the Kubiks' approach:
Home-Based Rearing: Puppies are raised in a family environment—not kennels—surrounded by real-life sights and sounds to build confidence and adaptability.
Early Socialization: A structured routine of handling, exposure to new environments, and gentle stressors prepares puppies for life as family pets, service dogs, or emotional support animals.
Ethical Standards: With a strong focus on temperament, health-tested bloodlines, and responsible practices, the Kubiks emphasize quality over quantity.
Ongoing Support: Golden Gals Connecticut provides lifetime guidance to their puppy families, ensuring continued success and well-being long after adoption.
The feature also mentions the recent launch of the Golden Gals’ blog, which aims to educate new and aspiring pet owners on training, nutrition, socialization, and responsible care.
“There’s so much misinformation out there,” Ashley noted in the article. “People think love is enough, but dogs need structure, early training, and consistent care. We want to give people the tools to do it right.”
Recognition for a Mission-Driven Breeder
This feature article recognizes Golden Gals Connecticut as a standout example of how breeders can positively influence a dog’s life from the very beginning. With over 13 years of experience, the Kubiks continue to lead with compassion, integrity, and deep respect for the animals they raise.
For more information on Golden Gals Connecticut and to read the full spotlight article, please visit the website here .
About Golden Gals Connecticut
Golden Gals Connecticut is a small, family-based golden retriever breeding program in Bethany, CT. Founded by Ashley and Steve Kubik, the program focuses on raising healthy, well-tempered puppies in a kennel-free environment. Their breeding practices emphasize early socialization, champion bloodlines, and lifelong support for every family they serve.
